availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abel C. Ross (Knox County, Missouri, farmer)

body.p: Knox County, Missouri, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sophia S. Ross. Father of Henry L. Ross, Miranda F. Ross, Mary E. E. Ross, Louisa D. Ross, James T. Ross, and Julia A. Ross. Farmer in Boone County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Knox County, Missouri, in 1860. Farmer in Goodland, Missouri, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 145B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, Knox County, Salt River, p. 152.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Knox County, Salt River, p. 850A.
"Abel Carson Ross (1821-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial #99499570, accessed August 18, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99499570.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Knox County, MO, July 1863, p. 377.
Missouri, Wills and Probate Records, 1766-1988, Missouri County, District, and Probate Courts, Knox County Administration Bonds, Letters, vol. 2-3, 1879-1894, p. 267.
